question_text: Which Islamic empire, founded by Babur after his victory at the First Battle of Panipat in 1526, ruled much of the Indian subcontinent and produced architectural masterpieces like the Taj Mahal?
distractors: The Delhi Sultanate
The Maratha Empire
The Gupta Empire

question_text: Which international organization, formally established at a 1961 summit in Belgrade, allowed countries led by Nehru, Tito, and Nasser to avoid aligning with either superpower during the Cold War?
distractors: The Warsaw Pact
The League of Nations
The Group of 77

question_text: Which 1950 South African law provided the legal framework for apartheid by requiring every inhabitant to be classified by race into categories such as Black, White, and Coloured?
distractors: The Group Areas Act
The Bantu Education Act
The Suppression of Communism Act

question_text: During the 1994 Rwandan genocide, approximately how long did the systematic mass killing of the Tutsi minority by Hutu extremists last before being ended by the RPF's military victory?
correct_answer: Approximately 100 days, from April to July 1994
distractors: Approximately two years, from 1993 to 1995
Approximately three weeks in April 1994
Approximately nine months, from January to September 1994

question_text: The ancient Phoenicians, based in city-states like Tyre, Sidon, and Byblos along the eastern Mediterranean coast, are most celebrated for developing what writing innovation that became the ancestor of the Greek and Latin alphabets?
distractors: A pictographic script similar to Egyptian hieroglyphs
A cuneiform syllabary adapted from Mesopotamia
A logographic writing system with over 600 characters

question_text: The 1868 Meiji Restoration in Japan overthrew the Tokugawa shogunate and restored power to Emperor Meiji. What was the primary consequence of this political revolution for Japan?
correct_answer: Rapid industrialization and adoption of Western technology and institutions
distractors: A return to feudal isolation and rejection of all foreign influence
The establishment of a communist government modeled on China
The division of Japan into independent regional kingdoms

question_text: In April 1955, representatives from 29 Asian and African nations gathered in Bandung, Indonesia for a landmark conference. What was the primary aim of this meeting that helped lay the groundwork for the Non-Aligned Movement?
correct_answer: To promote Afro-Asian cooperation and oppose colonialism by any nation
distractors: To form a military alliance against the Soviet Union
To establish a unified Asian-African currency and trade bloc
To negotiate collective membership in the United Nations Security Council

question_text: The Haitian Revolution (1791-1804) resulted in the former French colony of Saint-Domingue becoming the independent nation of Haiti. What makes this revolution historically unique among independence movements?
correct_answer: It was the only successful slave rebellion to establish an independent nation
distractors: It was the first revolution to establish a constitutional monarchy
It was the only colonial revolt supported by the British Royal Navy
It was the first independence movement led by European-born settlers

question_text: The Songhai Empire, one of the largest empires in African history with its capital at Gao, was defeated at the 1591 Battle of Tondibi. What critical military advantage did the invading Moroccan forces possess?
correct_answer: Gunpowder weapons including arquebuses and cannons
distractors: A vastly larger army of over 200,000 cavalry soldiers
War elephants imported from the Indian subcontinent
Iron-hulled warships that controlled the Niger River

question_text: The Reconquista, spanning roughly 770 years of Christian military campaigns against Muslim-ruled al-Andalus on the Iberian Peninsula, concluded in 1492 with which decisive event?
correct_answer: The fall of the Emirate of Granada to Ferdinand and Isabella
distractors: The Ottoman conquest of Constantinople in 1453
The signing of the Treaty of Tordesillas between Spain and Portugal
The expulsion of the Moors following the Battle of Las Navas de Tolosa
